meanings.definition: The act of catching birds at night by holding a torch or lantern over their roosting place.
meanings.sent1: Batfowling requires patience and a steady hand to catch the birds at night.
meanings.sent2: People used to engage in batfowling to gather food for their families in the olden days.
meanings.sent3: The children found the idea of batfowling quite amusing, imagining themselves as bird catchers.
meanings.sent4: In a world of darkness, batfowling becomes a beacon of light for those seeking sustenance.
meanings.sent5: The image of batfowling under the moonlit sky stayed etched in his memory forever.
